data.title: Best Tech Movies That Every Programmer Must Watch
data.meta_description: A Computer Science portal for geeks. It contains well written, well thought and well explained computer science and programming articles, quizzes and practice/competitive programming/company interview Questions.
data.text:
Every individual takes their life similar to movie fantasies. Every programmer always loves to see their professional life from the perspective of movies. We all know that Hollywood is well-known for showing the best application of technologies like Artificial Intelligence, Hacking, etc. perfectly. Therefore let us take note of the best movies that every programmer should watch.

Best Movies for Programmers

Let’s get started with the list of must-watch tech movies for every programmer:

1. Tron

The movie is released in 1982. It is a science fiction action-adventure film. The direction was by Steven Lisberger from a story by Lisberger and starred Jeff Bridges as a computer programmer. The Movie shows how Jeff Bridges get sucked into the computer world and tries to escape from there by interacting with the computer world. At last, he manages to get skipped from this computer world and return to the normal world by applying his knowledge. This turns out to be the best movie to watch for programmers as it teaches us to apply our tech knowledge in different situations.

2. Hackers

The movie is released in 1995. It is directed by Iain Softley and stars Jonny Lee Miller. This movie was released when the usage of the internet was not famous. The movie shows how few high school student uses their tech knowledge for corporate extortion. The movie got mixed reviews from critics but it was a masterpiece for programmers and security enthusiasts.

3. The Pirates of Silicon Valley

The movie was released in 1999. It was a biographical drama film. The direction was by Martyn Burke and starred Noah Wyle as Steve Jobs and Anthony Michael Hall as Bill Gates. This movie tells us how the great software companies “Apple” and “Microsoft” become so successful. The main idea of these movies is how the creator of “Apple”, Steve Jobs, and the creator of “Microsoft’, Bill Gates came up with the idea of personal computing that can be used by everyone.

The movie begins with IBM in the early 1980s. At that time IBM was unbeatable in the field of computing. And at that time Steve Jobs set up their own company named “Apple” and started making computers in the garage. Ultimately the movie shows the ideology and methodology both of them used for making the line the computer and now they are one of the top software companies in the world.

4. Antitrust

It was released in 2001. It is a techno-thriller film. The direction is by Peter Howitt. If you want to know about the dirty side of the software world then this movie is best recommended. The film frame the ideal programmers working in a corporation company providing a significant salary and informal working environment. A young talented programmer gets the job in the organization but later finds out that something is wrong there.

The programmer then uses his tech skills and find out the issue. This movie is an all-time favorite for programmers as it shows the best way of applying your tech knowledge.

5. The Social Network

The movie was released in 2010. It is a biographical drama film. The direction was by David Fincher and starred Jesse Eisenberg as founder Mark Zuckerberg, along with Andrew Garfield as Eduardo Saverin. This Movie shows the true story of Facebook and Mark Zuckerberg.

The Movie is all about the challenges faced by Mark Zuckerberg while building the world’s most popular and highly used social networking site “Facebook”. Any programmer will love to watch this movie as it shows a clear dedication to achieving one’s goals.

6. The Internship

The movie was released in 2013. It is a comedy film. The direction was by Shawn Levy, written by Vince Vaughn, and stars Vince Vaughn and Owen Wilson. It shows how recently these gentlemen as laid-off salesmen who attempt to finish at a much younger age and are more technically skilled applicants for a job at Google.

They were invited to join the google internship at Google’s Headquarters in Mountain View California. And there they compete with the younger group of people who are tech genius and skilled. This is the best-recommended movie for those who think that they are too old for learning technical stuff.

7. Jobs

The movie is released in 2013. It is a biographical drama film. The direction was by Joshua Michael Stern and starred Ashton Kutcher as Steve Jobs the founder of the largest software company “Apple”. The film is based on the life of Steve Jobs from his school life until the invention of the iPod. As Steve Jobs has been an inspiration to programmers all over the world, this movie is indeed inspirational. The movie not only shows the success story of Jobs but also shows their vision and motivation of jobs to change the world.

8. The Imitation Game

The movie was released in 2014. It is a historical drama film. The direction was by Morten Tyldum and written by Graham Moore, based on the 1983 biography Alan Turing: The Enigma by Andrew Hodges. This movie the invention of the world’s very first computer by Alan Turing and his team. At the end of the movie, it is shown Alan and his team come up with a way to decode the German Enigma Code. It can turn out to be the best movie for programmers.

9. Ex Machina

The Movie was released in 2014. It is a science fiction psychological thriller film. The direction was by Alex Garland. The movie shows a lot of applications of technology like artificial intelligence for mankind to have a better life. The story revolves around the programmer who is invited by his CEO to an intelligent humanoid robot. It shows the struggle of programmers in the software world and the harmful effects on society if this technology is not used properly.

10. Matrix

Released in the year 1999, Matrix is a science fiction film that is loved by all. People have watched this sci-fi movie many times as the story is very intriguing where Neo a hacker receives a call from Morpheus a terrorist. This is when authorities get to know about him and starts a mission to hunt him down. The complete combat is very interesting as Neo fights with the supercomputer. Also, the movie is well-suited for programmers due to its loop and recursion concepts. The directors of the movie did an amazing job thus making the movie loved by all.

11. Takedown

Release in the year 2000, Takedown (Trackdown) is an American crime thriller based on a non-fiction book Takedown. The movie depicts how Kevin Mitnick a hacker uses his talent and supplies his programs in order to dodge an FBI investigation. However, Mitnick invades numerous computers in the movie but when he tries to do the same with Tsutomu Shimomura’s computer, things take a turn. And from here the movie becomes a love for all the computer enthusiasts and programmers as the epic chase through cyberspace starts among both protagonists. Hence, the movie can be included in the list of programmers and will encourage them to ask numerous questions.

12. The Fifth Estate

Released in the year 2013, The Fifth Estate is a biographical thriller film based on a very famous incident of Wikileaks and the events that led to its creation. Wikileaks was established by Julian Assange in the year 2006 a journalist who used this platform to reveal many corrupt firms and leaders. The film leads toward the complete creation of a website and how it is used for completing a particular purpose. For the programmers, this movie can be a good watch as they will be able to learn a lot, and also it is quite interesting.

Conclusion:

Hence, these were the movies that can be included in the list of programmers that they can watch in order to increase their interest in programming. They can learn new things in an interesting way and help them to learn things from a different perspective.
